meanings.definition: To lower in rank or position.
meanings.sent1: She was demoting the employee for not following the rules.
meanings.sent2: The manager decided to demote the supervisor to a lower position.
meanings.sent3: The demoting of the captain to a private caused quite a stir among the troops.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the pawn demoting the queen was a strategic move.
meanings.sent5: The demoting of the star player shocked the entire team.

meanings.definition: To reduce the importance or value of something.
meanings.sent1: The negative review was demoting the restaurant's reputation.
meanings.sent2: Constant criticism can demote one's self-esteem over time.
meanings.sent3: The demoting of the award by the recipient was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The rainy weather demoted the outdoor picnic to an indoor gathering.
meanings.sent5: The demoting of the antique vase to a mere decoration saddened the collector.
